snippet.title: Discrete Math: 01. Binomial Coefficients in Pascal's Triangle
snippet.description:
You may have used Pascal's Triangle to find the coefficients of (a+b)^2 or (a+b)^3.  In this video I provide a proof for why the coefficients in the expansion (a+b)^n are the binomial coefficients nCk which are found in Pascal's Triangle.
--An introduction to Discrete Math by Dr. Sarada Herke.


Links to the related videos:
http://youtu.be/ait2H2piIJw - Discrete Math: 02. Rowsums of Pascal's Triangle
http://youtu.be/J1yly1DUlRc - 5 Reasons to like Pascal's Triangle

For quick videos about Math tips and useful facts, check out my other channel
"Spoonful of Maths" - http://youtube.com/spoonfulofmaths
